Flash Floods Near Los Alamos Could Wash Through Canyons Full Of Nuclear Waste
The Intel Hub
July 20, 2011

Congress and officials are worried that flash floods could wash through canyons near Los Alamos that are contaminated with World War 2 era radioactive waste.

Los Alamos officials have claimed that their is nothing to worry about but considering the long history of radiation cover ups, many believe it would be illogical to completely trust Los Alamos employees.

The fact that this extremely important information only gets a passing glance by the corporate controlled media is a clear example of how corrupt the major media outlets actually are.

The radiation dangers near Los Alamos come as a nuclear whistleblower and a watchdog agency report highlighted very real dangers and vulnerabilities at the Watts Bar Nuclear Power Plant In Tennessee.

    “Basically the books are being cooked, people are saying things they are not doing, that they swear under oath they have been done and they just aren’t done.”

We now live in a world where we have to worry about the constant danger of unreported radiation as governments of the world continually claim low levels of radiation are safe.
